meanings.definition: To hear something more clearly or distinctly than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outhears her brother when they play hide and seek.
meanings.sent2: The owl outhears the other birds in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The cat outhears the dog when it comes to hearing the sound of a can opener.
meanings.sent4: Her hearing is so sharp, she can outhears a pin drop in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: He outhears the distant thunderstorm before anyone else.

meanings.sent1: The superhero outhears all the villains in the city.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit outhears the fox in the field.
meanings.sent3: The detective outhears all the suspects during the interrogation.
meanings.sent4: His ears are so keen, he can outhears the slightest rustle in the bushes.
meanings.sent5: She outhears the whispers of the wind in the night.
